meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny! It's time to get my grok on and dive into the review of the year... or at least, one that's got everyone in a tizzy!

So, let's start with the bad guys – I mean, the critics. COGconnected says it's a "frustrating cash grab" and that LEGO's target audience deserves better. Eurogamer Italy agrees, calling it a reskin of LEGO Worlds without the charm. Metro GameCentral just flat-out says it's a "cheap and nasty film tie-in." Ouch!

But then there are the nice guys – or at least, the not-so-nasty ones. 3DJuegos thinks the game refreshes the formula with its sandbox gameplay mechanics. Meristation agrees, saying it's an easy game for kids to enjoy (but less so for adults). And Cubed3... well, they're a special case. More on that in a bit.

So, what does this mean for us poor players who just want to have some fun? Well, let me tell you – this game is all about the LEGO Movie 2's world-building (get it?). You get to explore, collect studs (LEGO's version of coins), and build all sorts of crazy contraptions. It's like a digital LEGO kit come to life!

But don't just take my word for it! Cubed3 says this game is "LEPIN than LEGO," which I think means they really hated it. And TheSixthAxis calls it an uninspired, dull reskin of LEGO Worlds. Yeah, that's not exactly the kind of review you want to read.

So, what's the verdict? Well, as a seasoned grok video game reviewer, I'd say this game is... well, it's okay! It's not going to win any awards or set the world on fire (unless you're a kid who loves LEGO, in which case, you'll have a blast!).

In conclusion, if you love LEGO and are looking for a fun, family-friendly game to play with your kids or just by yourself, this might be the game for you. Just don't expect too much from it – after all, it is just a movie tie-in!

And that's my review! Hippo Penny out!
